description: This course examines how modern theories of chemical bonding are applied to an
understanding of the chemistry of the elements of the periodic table. Students explore
chemical structures and spectra on the basis of molecular symmetry and group theory.
Topics covered include inorganic reactions, chemical periodicity, acid-base systems,
coordination compounds, organometallic compounds, nonmetal chemistry, and cluster
compounds. Offered annually in the spring semester. Prerequisite: CHEM 248.
